meanings.definition: A Scottish term for a wallet or purse.
meanings.sent1: I keep my money in my wallie.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new wallie to keep her coins in.
meanings.sent3: The wallie was so full, it could barely close.
meanings.sent4: Her wallie was a treasure chest of memories.
meanings.sent5: The wallie jingled with the sound of coins.

meanings.definition: A type of shot in ice hockey where the puck is lifted off the ice and into the net.
meanings.sent1: He scored a goal with a powerful wallie.
meanings.sent2: The player practiced his wallie shot for hours.
meanings.sent3: The goalie couldn't stop the impressive wallie.
meanings.sent4: The wallie soared past the goalie like a rocket.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the wallie found the back of the net.

meanings.definition: A type of dance move popular in the 1980s where one jumps and kicks their legs out to the side.
meanings.sent1: She showed off her best wallie on the dance floor.
meanings.sent2: The dancers synchronized their wallies perfectly.
meanings.sent3: His wallie was so energetic, it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The wallie was like a burst of energy on the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The wallie move was the highlight of the dance routine.
